title: Tammy Abraham reveals Chelsea stars 'upset' with Frank Lampard over pre-season running drills
text:
Chelsea's stars were 'upset' with Frank Lampard's pre-season running drills, according to Tammy Abraham.

But the England striker admits all that hard work is now worth it after four straight wins.

Two consecutive victories in the Premier League have seen the Blues rise up to fifth in the table.

Tammy Abraham believes that Chelsea's hard work in pre-season is now paying off

Abraham admits that Chelsea's players were 'upset' with Frank Lampard's pre-season drive

And the recent upturn in form is being credited to the pre-season drive.

'I think a lot of players were a bit upset about how much running we had to do in pre-season, but it's all paying off now', he told The Athletic.

'It all makes sense why we did it, why we had such a hard pre-season.

'From when the manager came in he told us the style of play, how he wanted us to play, how to press.

'At first, I couldn't do it. I had no energy. But as the season has gone on, I've got used to it.

'Now we know what he wants in the press, so for us, it's about giving defenders no time on the ball – just rushing them.'
description: Chelsea's stars were 'upset' with Frank Lampard's pre-season running drills, according to Tammy Abraham. But he admits the hard work has been worth it after an upturn in form.
